preprocessing¶

Utilities.preprocessing.spikeThreshold(bits, option=0)[source]¶

A very simple routine for finding the start and end of a spike

Parameters:
  • bits (np.array) – a thresholded spike train. This should be bianary.
  • option – decide wether to return the spike beginnings and endings in the same array (option = 0) or seperately (option = 1)
Utilities.preprocessing.wavefilter(data, maxlevel=6)[source]¶

This function requires that the NumPy and PyWavelet packages are installed. They are freely available at:

NumPy - http://numpy.scipy.org/ PyWavelets - http://www.pybytes.com/pywavelets/#download from the command line’easy_install PyWavelets’ seems to do the trick

Filter a multi-channel signal using wavelet filtering.

Params data:n x m array, n=number of channels in the signal, m=number of samples in the signal
Params maxlevel:
 the level of decomposition to perform on the data. This integer implicitly defines the cutoff frequency of the filter. Specifically, cutoff frequency = samplingrate/(2^(maxlevel+1))
Returns:filtered data in same shape as input data
